meanings.definition: Seels (verb): to close or fasten with a seal
meanings.sent1: She seels the envelope before sending the letter.
meanings.sent2: He always seels the package securely before shipping it.
meanings.sent3: The detective seels the evidence to protect it from contamination.
meanings.sent4: Her love for him seels her heart from any other suitors.
meanings.sent5: The magician seels the box before performing the trick.

meanings.definition: Seels (noun): a type of seal or closure
meanings.sent1: The seels on the container kept the contents fresh.
meanings.sent2: The ancient scroll had a seels made of wax.
meanings.sent3: The treasure chest had a golden seels that sparkled in the light.
meanings.sent4: The door had a rusty seels that creaked when opened.
meanings.sent5: The envelope had a seels with the company logo embossed on it.

meanings.sent1: The seels container protected the fragile items inside.
meanings.sent2: The seels door prevented anyone from entering the room.
meanings.sent3: The seels package was delivered intact despite the rough handling.
meanings.sent4: The seels vault contained the most valuable treasures.
meanings.sent5: The seels document was kept in a secure safe.
